alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 05 at 6:37PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE NORTHWEST AVALANCHE CENTER. ...THE NORTHWEST AVALANCHE CENTER IN SEATTLE HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...VERY DANGEROUS CONDITIONS WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE WASHINGTON CASCADES, OLYMPICS AND MT. HOOD. * WHERE...HIGH DANGER FOR THE OLYMPIC MOUNTAINS, WEST SLOPES OF THE CASCADES FROM HIGHWAY 20 TO THE COLUMBIA RIVER INCLUDING SNOQUALMIE, STEVENS,AND WHITE PASSES, EAST SLOPES OF THE CASCADES FROM THE CANADIAN BORDER TO THE COLUMBIA RIVER, AND MT. HOOD. * WHEN...IN EFFECT FROM JAN 5TH WED 18:00 PST THROUGH JAN 6TH THU 18:00 PST. * IMPACTS...HEAVY SNOW, STRONG WINDS, AND RAPIDLY WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL CREATE VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. LARGE NATURAL AVALANCHES WILL OCCUR AT ALL ELEVATIONS INCLUDING OPEN SLOPES IN THE FOREST. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...BACKCOUNTRY TRAVEL IS NOT RECOMMENDED. AVOID ALL AREAS WHERE AN AVALANCHE MAY START, RUN, OR STOP. CONSULT HTTPS://WWW.NWAC.US/ OR WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.
